action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Write your plan for your next actions on the line below your action, starting with "Next actions:".
For example:
> open cupboard
Next actions: take orange, eat orange

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow in the refrigerator, the book in the wardrobe and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a table, a chair and a couch. There is a passage to a hallway here.

> look around
Next actions: Examine each object in the room (side table, table, chair, couch) to see if any of the items I need to move are present. Then, explore the hallway.

content: Examine each object in the room (side table
couch) to see if any of the items I need to move are present. Then

action.content: ['Examine each object in the room (side table', 'table', 'chair', 'couch) to see if any of the items I need to move are present. Then', 'explore the hallway.']

content: I don't know what you mean.

content.arg:
No terminal matches '(' in the current parser context, at line 1 col 33

examine each object in the room (side table
                                ^
Expected one of: 
	* WORD
	* WS

action.content: I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.

You are right to call me out on that! My apologies. I defaulted to a common adventure game convention. I will stick to more direct actions.

> go to hallway
Next actions: Explore the hallway to find the pillow, book, and plate. Once found, return to the living room and begin placing items in their correct locations (refrigerator, wardrobe, shelf).
